poem:
### Echoes from Dulwich

Words like stones,  
thrown in jest, they say,  
but the air remembers  
its history,  
a whisper's passage  
carving scars  
on tender skin.  
No laughter  
can muffle  
the truth's sharp edge—  
the echo  
of mockery,  
unfurling its shadow  
in the sunlit  
courtyard.
